pull.title: rpc: Remove unused boost::this_thread::interruption_point
pull.body:
There are predefined interruption points for `boost::thread`: https://www.boost.org/doc/libs/1_71_0/doc/html/thread/thread_management.html#interruption_points

However, the rpc threads are `std::thread`, which does not have an `std::thread::interrupt` member function to request interruption: https://dev.visucore.com/bitcoin/doxygen/httpserver_8cpp.html#ae1a63374e18b9abd348eb74e4243ea34

Thus, the interruption points can be removed.

rpc: Remove unused boost::this_thread::interruption_point

events.body:
ACK fa5facd3e72b6d61374b0b93b722b55e2b090020, this does nothing.

If the goal is to be interruptible, add checks for `IsRPCRunning()` instead (assuming RPC code).

issue.title: Bitcoin PR tracking
issue.body: The main purpose of this issue is to keep track of Pull Requests on Bitcoin since version 0.19.1 identifying those which make a porting LitecoinZ.

issue.title: Backport upstream PRs that remove Boost usage
issue.body:
The PRs we are missing, in merged-to-upstream order:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13743
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17382
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16728
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/17405
